Reward casket (easy)

Advanced data
Item ID20546

A reward casket (easy) is received after completing the final clue of an easy clue scroll trail, and contains the final reward for the trail. In addition to items listed below, various elemental and higher level runes can be received as part of an easy clue scroll reward.

While players can only have one of each type of clue scroll in their possession, they can possess unlimited amounts of reward caskets, and are eligible to receive clue scrolls again once it is obtained.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

Easy clues generate a minimum of 2 rewards and a maximum of 4, granting an average of 3 rewards per casket. The rewards consist of generic items, shared treasure trail items and items that are unique for easy clues. Additionally, players have a 1/50 chance to receive a master clue scroll upon opening an easy casket.

All droprates are confirmed by Mod Tide.[1][2] The listed rarities are per roll.

The average loot roll is worth 21,874. On average, easy clues are worth 65,622. The 1/50 chance of receiving a master clue scroll adds another 15,293, for a total expected value per clue of 80,915.

The probability to receive a clue scroll unique item from an easy casket is 247/1080, or roughly 22.9%. [3]

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
15 August 2019
(update | poll)

The locks on the reward casket have been changed to reflect the tier of Treasure Trail it comes from.

11 April 2019
(update | poll)

All Treasure Trails caskets were changed to be stackable.

6 March 2014
(update | poll)

Clue scrolls and caskets now state the levels in their names.
